meanings.definition: Reserve accommodations or a ticket in advance.
meanings.sent1: I booked a hotel room for our vacation.
meanings.sent2: She booked a flight for her business trip next week.
meanings.sent3: The family booked the entire resort for their reunion.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to work was so strong, it seemed like he had booked his future success.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sunset over the ocean was so beautiful, it felt like nature had booked a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Record information in a book or register.
meanings.sent1: The librarian booked the returned books back into the system.
meanings.sent2: He booked the sales figures in the ledger for the month.
meanings.sent3: The detective booked the suspect's alibi in his notebook.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was so sharp, it seemed like she had booked every detail of the event.
meanings.sent5: The historian booked the ancient manuscript into the archives for safekeeping.

meanings.sent1: The police officer booked the suspect for shoplifting.
meanings.sent2: They booked the criminal after a high-speed chase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was booked for stealing treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rainstorm booked everyone indoors for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The security guard booked the trespasser for entering the restricted area.
